title: Mobile Microlearning Course for Strengthening Academic Writing Competencies: Applying Social Science Research Methodologies and Citizen Engagement Case Studies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of academic writing, foundational concepts in social science research methodologies (including history, geography, politics, economics), basic knowledge of social systems and citizen rights.
context.additional_context: Providing a flexible learning environment using personal devices (BYOD) and conducting project-based assessments through socioscientific case analysis. Learners select research topics to address local community issues and derive practical research outcomes by analyzing relationships with various stakeholders.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically explain the research writing process—from selecting social science topics to structuring a thesis—and develop a research design that considers historical and geographical contexts.

Learners can draft social science research findings systematically according to the IMRAD structure (Introduction, Methods, Results, and Discussion), incorporate peer feedback, and apply an analytical framework reflecting political and economic variables.
Learners can submit a completed thesis applying APA-style citations and social science reference formatting rules, and utilize academic expressions that account for cultural diversity.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
